meanings.definition: To coat or treat with metal
meanings.sent1: The workers will metallise the gate to protect it from rust.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to metallise the sculpture for a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if we can metallise our bicycles to make them look like robots.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to metallise the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to metallise the ocean, turning it into liquid gold.

meanings.sent1: The alchemist claimed he could metallise any substance into gold.
meanings.sent2: The intense heat will metallise the ore into pure iron.
meanings.sent3: It would be amazing if we could metallise our thoughts into tangible objects.
meanings.sent4: Her determination seemed to metallise her dreams into reality.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand appeared to metallise the flowers into silver blooms.
